creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by David Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: landscape with pale colors: large, angular cliff juts out at L, cutting into scene of bay with low mountains; two tall firs growing from rock at LRC; a small cluster of houses on stilts at center is flanked by two large rocks; figure at LLQ with bowed head crossing bridge
inscription: URQ: 性本拙衣食棲遁暮昔賢自耕幽谷底或嘯白雲巓釆薬隋麇鹿煎茶汲石泉□□吾願足時復仰蒼天 (By nature I am clumsy at earning my food -- / I admire the ancient sages for their reclusion! /  Myself, I plow the bottom of hidden valleys / Or chant atop peaks among white clouds. / Gathering herbs, I follow deer and roebuck, / For brewing tea, draw water from rocky streams. / \"Free-and-easy wandering!\" My wishes are satisfied: / From time to time the bright moon comes, / its reflection appearing right in my cup of wine.) (SA)
markings: URC, oval relief; URQ, square intaglio and square relief
medium: Ink and light color on silk
signed: URQ: 壬子□清和月　古道人
title: Landscape
